page.title: 01THE TOWN OF BULWELL.
page.content: Saint Mary's Church chimes the hour in the quaint old town of Bulwell.An old community where nothing much happens. Always calm never out of the ordinary. The old wheels go round as the nearby Hucknall colliery produces coal which both communitys depend on.Down on the market Armies of salesmen try to sell goods at a fair price.They call from behind there makeshift counters trying to out shout the salesmen on the other side of town.Then the battle of the stallholders is over and they pack up and go.On Bulwell bogs its a hot day and children scream with delight as they run riot down the Lean the place buzzes with excitement.From the river the back of the old town hall is in clear view.Bulwell town is very deceiving sometimes calm sometimes very alarming.
